findings.fact: $200M ARR in under one year with only 100 employees; activation ownership moved from growth teams to product teams
60-70% of traditional growth tactics no longer apply; must re-find product-market fit every 3 months due to AI capability advances

findings.fact: Replaced 10 SDRs with 1 person + AI; pioneering the 'GTM engineer' role that combines go-to-market strategy with technical implementation

How I AI: OpenAI product lead on getting the most out of Codex

findings.fact: Codex workflows use structured planning (Plans.md), parallel development via Git worktrees, and automated code review at scale

newContent.title: ChatGPT apps are about to be the next big distribution channel

summary: First scan of Lenny's Newsletter yields exceptional AI-organizational content. Three HIGH-relevance findings: (1) SaaStr replaced 10-person sales team with 20 AI agents managed by 1.2 humans; (2) Lovable reached $200M ARR with 100 employees, shifting activation to product teams and re-finding PMF every 3 months; (3) Vercel replaced 10 SDRs with 1 person + AI, pioneering 'GTM engineer' hybrid role. Strong signal that sales/GTM functions are rapidly restructuring around AI agents. Lovable and Vercel are both candidate specimens. SaaStr findings provide macro-level evidence of AI-driven role elimination in sales.
